result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Diangello Maurice Bradley

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:04 AM Defendant Diangello Maurice Bradley in court by video with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court recalls warrant previously ordered when defendant did not appear when case called at 9:04 AM. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.

records.addlTxt: Walter H Isaacson

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:16 PM Defendant Diangello Maurice Bradley in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $650 Signature bond with conditions:  No contact directly or indirectly with victim K.D.C, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone. Matter continued for decision on Preliminary Hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
